course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Developing the Leader in You
course.description: Leading people effectively is a tremendous challenge, a great opportunity, and a serious responsibility.  This course is about developing your full potential as a leader.  The focus will be on skills development so that you can use leadership theories and concepts to improve your leadership skills.  Topics include leadership traits and behavior theories, leadership values, the team concept and group dynamics and leader as coach and developer of people.  Interactive class activities will be conducted including videos, discussions and self-assessment exercises.

reviews.author: Jodie
reviews.title: Good grade good professor
reviews.comment_content: The course is quite suitable for you if you are interested in developing charisma and leadership skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor has put in a lot of effort preparing for the courses
reviews.comment_grading: the grade is fair if you are good at writing, you are not suggested to take this course if you are a year one student - as most of the students are in year three to year four, it is actually quite difficult for you guys to compete with them in terms of presentation and writing. Most of the year one students in the class got a C range. If you ask and answer questions in class, the professor will recognize you and there is high chance that you will get a better grade
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is quite high. basically you have to write a few passages per week and there's group activities. You have readings and other paper works to prepare before class, but the mid term takes a very little percentage of the whole grade, which is good for people who don't like memorizing things.

reviews.author: yaboi
reviews.title: Fun class that can actually be useful
reviews.comment_content:
Types of leaders
Personality tests: MBTI, The Big 5
Leadership styles: DiSC profiles

We also had two case studies for the first few classes but they stopped the case studies after taking a poll and seeing that the class didn't engage with them.
reviews.comment_teaching: There are many guest speakers and Prof Mark and JC talk about the guest speaker. It is a very discussion based class and they definitely facilitate good discussions. Make sure you participate and ask questions if you want to do well in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
After-class reflection notes: 40% of the final grade. After each of the first eleven class sessions, students will be asked to write up to 400 words reflecting on the class session –both on what they experienced in class and their reaction to this experience. Given the intensely personal nature of this experience, the instructors will grade these reflection notes on effort:
- 4 points: deep and well thought-out introspection
- 3 points: strong effort to reflect upon the experience
- 2 points: some effort to reflect upon the experience
- 1 point: casual/inadequate attempt to reflect upon the experience.
Your 8 best scoring reflections count towards your grade. Average score for the reflections was 3.2/4.

Take home exam: 40% of the final grade. To be submitted via Canvas on the last scheduled day of  lectures  (11.59pm,  6th May)  this  examination  will  consist  of  two  parts.  The  first  part  will review the objective and factual content covered in class, and will consist of open questions. The second part will consist of essays asking you to describe your leadership style, how you can make it work across various situations, and in what contexts it would be most effective.

In-class participation: 20% of the final grade. Students will be evaluated on their engagement of the instructors, guest lecturers, and fellow classmates in class and group discussions.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically just one 400 word reflection every week. Our class was on Wednesday and the reflection was due on Friday so you don't have too much time to do it so make sure you write it as soon as class is over. Make the reflection personal by including stories from your past, they really like that.

reviews.author: wym
reviews.title: MGMT1120 Developing the leader in you
reviews.comment_content: Practical leadership theories which involves memorization in quizzes. The most useful ones are the real-life examples provided and their respective resolutions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Levermore is very enthusiastic and passionate about getting his students involved. There are a lot of simulations and in-class discussions so that all students can have an opportunity to voice out their opinions in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
You are graded on 4 reflection logs, 2 quizzes and class participation. It is not easy to score an A+ in the course, since an average performance in one component is enough to drag you down to an A. I scored nearly highest in all of the reflection logs but an average on one of the quizzes and got an A at the end. The grading is quite competitive since a lot of people score very close marks.

Around 10 people got A+ when I took the course.
reviews.comment_workload: We have to write 4 reflection logs in total, and to get a very high grade, you would need to consult the professor every time so that he reviews them before he actually marks them. The reflection logs can be tedious. You need to attend all the lessons and some guest speaker series in order to get full participation points.

reviews.author: RN
reviews.title: Chill
reviews.comment_content:
Leadership skills concepts with some case studies and games in class, for example assuming you are the CEO of a company, what will you do in a given situation. A bit abstract but might be useful in the future.

There is a compulsory 1-day training camp, which aims to challenge yourself. Interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is chill and fun, seldom get bored, he even gave us personal phone number to contact him anytime if needed, could be a great mentor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair.
Bad luck coz met free-riders, grouping assigned by the prof.
Write-ups are done in groups which counts 40, so good teammates are needed.
For the participation, the key is to be more active in sharing your thoughts, but dun needa worry coz always got free discussions time.

Knowledge-based
1. Leadership commentary write-up I 15%
2. Putting knowledge to work write-up 25%
3. Take home examination 40%

In-class engagement
4. Attendance, participation, involvement 10%
5. Peer Evaluation 10%
reviews.comment_workload:
Light comparing to other courses.

Write-ups could be completed in a short time if you got responsible group mates.

The take home examination is simply writing a short essay, identifying the leadership skills of one of the characters in a given movie.

reviews.author: Weird Guy
reviews.comment_content: A course about the introduction to leadership. The course also includes activities that help you develop necessary skills. A lot of personality tests are given that help you understand yourself better. At the end, a scenario planning exercise is held in class that helps you understand the importance of leaders developing future plans for a company.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. LEVERMORE is one of the best professors I have had in UST. The lectures are conducted in a very professional manner. A lot of classroom interaction takes place that helps you know the other students better. Though it is a three hour class, you will never feel bored during class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite lenient with 3 personal logs taking 30% of the grade and a portfolio taking 20% of the grade. 10% goes to 3 quizzes which are based on the lecture slides and this is the only part of the course that requires memorisation. 40% goes to class participation. This includes weekly online discussion forums, in-class PRS questions, and class participation. Thus, attendance is necessary to get a good grade in this course. Ensure that you participate actively in the online forums as it gives you a higher chance of getting a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: I personally thought that the workload for this course is pretty high. 3 logs, 3 quizzes, a portfolio, a scenario planning exercise and actively participation in the online discussion forum. However, there is no midterm and final exam for this course. I learnt a lot from this course. So, I encourage you all to try this course.

reviews.author: Belinda
reviews.title: Developing the Leader in You
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces students to the basics of leadership but includes lots of activities to develop various soft skills of students, such as in-class negotiation and various action learning exercises. The final task is scenario planning.
reviews.comment_teaching: This should have been the best course that I have taken t HKUST. Roger is a very capable, nice and wonderful instructor leading the class in in-class exercises and conducting various talks outside lecture time.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was transparent, with 3 take-home assignments counting towards 30% of the grade and 1 portfolio which takes up 20% of the grade. The course bases 40% on attendance, which included online discussion forums, in-class PRS questions and in-class involvement. The last 10% goes to 3 quizzes which are conducted during lecture time.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this course is acceptable. There is no final exam but it is advised to spend more time and make sure the logs and portfolio is done with great detail and has lots of supporting details.

reviews.author: ljdjlalb
reviews.title: Review to 1120
reviews.comment_content:
-> Leadership skills
-> Group discussion over certain dilemmatic scenario
reviews.comment_teaching:
Chill and fun
Easy come easy go
Sometimes he would act like a jerk to challenge your thoughts. But it is aspiring and fun afterall. I do appeciate his doubt over my arugment. In real world, there are always people disagreeing with and you do have to think fast and stand on your ground. This kind of train up your 'reaction time'
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair, to be honest.
Scores for group assignments are around mean
Should be around 7-8 out of ten in attendance and involvement part
Should be full score in peer evaluation
Take home exam scores are not given but I wrote ~850 words out of 1000.

Turning out A range which is generous

reviews.author: deetee
reviews.comment_content:
Not something new honestly, but you do get to meet a lot of guest speakers and hear insights from other students. The class itself isn't the best, but the people in it are GOOD>>>
Group activities make you think think think and learn quite a bit
reviews.comment_teaching:
Joseph is a very funny guy and he will make you smile :)
He is super chill and encourages students to do their best.
He even gave us his WhatsApp and is ready to help any time, even on call.
His teaching can get a bit boring at times, but it's only because of the content.
reviews.comment_grading: Very very rewarding. Got an A even though I messed up the assignments a bit. The Prof looked at my attitude to want to improve so it was definitely very good :)
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty light tbh. Just a few essays, and some in-class participation and activities. Good stuff.

reviews.author: cyter
reviews.comment_content:
Learn the power and pitfalls of leadership
Experience the power of leadership by experiencing different leadership styles
Discover (and determine) your leadership style
Activate your leadership style across various situations
Practice ethical behaviors through an understanding of ethical dilemmas

Module 1: Introducing Leadership Styles
Module 2: Experiencing Leadership Styles
Module 3: Synthesizing Leadership Styles
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good teaching.
3-hours lectures
First half of the class would mostly consist of teaching based on powerpoints or guest sharing.
Later half of the class would be discussions with random classmates.
Professors are humorous which make the atmosphere comfortable and make classes interesting.
They give quite a lot if feedback on your weekly reflections s that you can improve and give better work for your final essay.
A relaxing course in the tense semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
After class reflection 40%
Take-home exam 40%
In-class participation 20%

Good grading as long as you put effort in your reflections
I got an average of 3.5 for each reflection.

Final essay consist of 3 essay questions. 2500 words for the whole essay.
reviews.comment_workload:
One short reflection of around 400 words per lecture.
1 final take-home essay with 1 week for you to finish.
Very light workload.

reviews.author: Keiko
reviews.comment_content: Inviting speakers every lesson for the first hour, then some group activities like discussions for the second hour. Quite boring tbh.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professors are great, they do talk a lot and try to have a friend like relationship with the students.
reviews.comment_grading: Didn't listen to the lesson at all and also not participating to the lesson will makes you lose your participation marks. Just speak more. Final is an essay which I totally forgot about it and just finished it in an afternoon. Got a B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to speak more in class in order to get that participation score thou.

reviews.author: Aaliya
reviews.comment_content: Decent content, good course if you are interested in building public speaking and leadership skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: Roger was very excited for every class and put in a lot of effort to keep the 3 hour lectures alive and interesting. Very fruitful guidance.
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall good grading. Course involves 2 reports, 1 presentation, a few in-class exercises, home works take very less time to complete and canvas discussions after every class.
I lost most of my marks through the online discussions.
reviews.comment_workload: A bit more workload than you'd expect for a common core course, but most of the workload are personality surveys you need to finish. Reports are easy to finish if you maintain a log of every class.

reviews.author: toxicboi
reviews.title: Obvious information, but a good refresher
reviews.comment_content: The content was very obvious. Involved some theory of decision making, leadership, ethics etc. The class duration is a lot which can be taxing especially during lunchtime. But if you strive through it, it should be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Levermore, is really nice, he tries to keep class as entertaining as possible. The activities are fun, and a lot of exchange students take this class.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is a very complex grading system - But the professor takes course feedback really seriously and keeps amending the course to make it as easy as he can for students. When I took this course, I had it much easier than the ones that took it before me.

In course quizzes (5% in total)
He will tell you the what kind of questions could come, stick to it carefully.

Class Participation (45%) - subdivided as
Use of PRS - 8%
Attendance and Participation - 18%
Discussion board on Canvas - 14%
5% Group Exercise - Too much effort for menial grade.

Two Reflection Papers - 50%
They are very specifically rubricked papers. Make sure to follow it precisely. Use as many well-detailed examples from your life as possible. MAKE SURE YOUR FORMATTING IS CORRECT. My spacing was wrong, and it ended up dropping my grade from A+ to C because I exceeded the page limit. Even the professor felt sorry for me because I was doing quite well in class.
Mean of the papers can go high, so each mark counts, make sure to visit the professor during office hours, to get feedback on your paper, and write it according to his suggestions.
reviews.comment_workload:
Writing the papers can be quite time-consuming, and tiring if you write them like me towards the very end.
Otherwise its just attending class once a week.

reviews.author: Akash
reviews.comment_content: The course content isn't that helpful. Its mainly basic leadership information, with a few seminars. However, for people who are shy of public speaking, it can prove to be valuable as it involves high class discussion.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is extremely good and takes a lot of initiative in helping the students. He arranges a lot of drop in sessions to make sure students know what to do.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fairly easy. If you follow through with the course and do everything, you should be in the A range.
reviews.comment_workload: There are a few essays which involve reflective points about past leadership experiences. The in class online quizzes are extremely easy and require 2-3 hours of studying.

reviews.author: Ah ip
reviews.title: hard to get good grade
reviews.comment_content: allow me to look more into the realistic business world in terms of how to make proper and swift decisions. the tutor sometimes put realistic examples in discussions to allow us to think more clearly.
reviews.comment_teaching: a little bit boring and the lecture for 3 hours is a little bit long. the contents sometimes too vague for the students to understand .
reviews.comment_grading: not good grade as there are projects and paper works. it is hard to get good grade by writing good articles .
reviews.comment_workload: not much work not demanding but hard to get good scores

reviews.author: Bruce Lee
reviews.title: No worries, easy A+
reviews.comment_content:
DISCLAIMERS
• please do not take this course if English is not your first language, you will be disadvantaged. There are a lot of international and exchange students.
• There are a fuck ton of final year students in this course.

I'm a second year kid and I think I was fine. I think I know a lot more about my personality now. That is really something. I don't remember much from my other courses since I cram a day before the finals.

Lot of personality tests (too lazy to do them normally), however you have to reference them in the logs so I had to complete them.

Got to speak to 70% of the people in my class and made a lot of friends. No midterm no final. one 3 hour class where you just basically socialise.

10/10 would do again.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor was good. He is chilled out, makes class relaxing.Quality lad who is always up for some banter after class.

Very clear english. Well structured class. Energetic. Can't ask for more.

Ace of a guy, marry him if I could.
reviews.comment_grading:
A+
I did almost nothing for the course so I felt it was brilliant.
98/100 in final reflection log
93, 92, 95 in other logs
9/10 and 10/10 in quiz
Talked a lot in class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Did some of my friends spend a lot of time on their logs? Yes
Did most? Probably Not.
I just started writing my logs a few hours before the deadline (yes, I had to stay up because of my laziness) and I got a decent score.

I could spend a lot more time on my core courses, and write bs in the reflection logs when I was tired on Sunday evening.

reviews.author: secretangel
reviews.title: Crazy course
reviews.comment_content: When I dropped one of my courses and added this course in the midway of add drop period, the course already has passed a few assignments (counted more than 10% !!) How come add drop period has not finished and this course already set graded assignments ? I'm already a year 4 student and throughout this 4 years I have not come across any courses like this. Crazy!~
reviews.comment_teaching: When I dropped one of my courses and added this course in the midway of add drop period, the course already has passed a few assignments (counted more than 10% !!) How come add drop period has not finished and this course already set graded assignments ? I'm already a year 4 student and throughout this 4 years I have not come across any courses like this. Crazy!~
reviews.comment_grading: When I dropped one of my courses and added this course in the midway of add drop period, the course already has passed a few assignments (counted more than 10% !!) How come add drop period has not finished and this course already set graded assignments ? I'm already a year 4 student and throughout this 4 years I have not come across any courses like this. Crazy!~
reviews.comment_workload: When I dropped one of my courses and added this course in the midway of add drop period, the course already has passed a few assignments (counted more than 10% !!) How come add drop period has not finished and this course already set graded assignments ? I'm already a year 4 student and throughout this 4 years I have not come across any courses like this. Crazy!~

reviews.author: philip7
reviews.comment_content: This is a very good course. Content is fun. This is a very good course. Content is fun.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching methods are great. Easy to understand the professor.The teaching methods are great. Easy to understand the professor.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is easy. Definitely take it if you want an easy grade. The grading is easy. Definitely take it if you want an easy grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The work load is minimal. The work load is minimal. If you do not want to work too hard this course is for you.
